alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 8:16AM CDT until June 03 at 8:34AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Verdigris River at Independence affecting Wilson and Montgomery Counties. Verdigris River at Coffeyville affecting Montgomery County. Verdigris River at Altoona affecting Wilson County. For the Verdigris River...including Altoona, Independence, Coffeyville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verdigris River at Altoona. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural fields and gravel road near the river bridge off of Highway 47 occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:01 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Verdigris River Altoona 19.0 19.6 Thu 8 am CDT 10.4 8.1 9.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
